page.title: 03A DOCTORS DAY 2
page.content: Treatment. He is on call for about one hundred hours per week, but he does not work all that time. He goes to meetings and on courses to keep up with new develpements, though he sometimes prefers to stick to old remedies. To be a good doctor you need a good memory, sympathy, and an ability to to understand what the other person is feeling. The diseases that have been eliminated since Doctor Clarke began his career are smallpox and polio. The most important drug discovery was the group known as antibiotics. Todays doctors have up to 3000 patients on their lists, Doctor Clarke would like to see this figure halved and feels that this would benefit both the doctor and the patients.
